div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 2307 Banasa, (mod. Souk-el Arbaa), (37) 120 km. NE of Rabat, Morocco, 1907 Burial: A.D. 17-18 (Jenkins) Contents: 4000 AR, 1 AE Mauretania, Juba II: den. (to yr. 42 = A.D. 17-18) Juba II with Cleopatra: den. Juba II with Ptolemy: den. Juba II: 1 AE (Lix mint) Disposition: London 90; Paris 82; Berlin 26; Athens 44; New York 24; Algiers; Schulman March 17, 1908, nos. 2264- 313, illus.; Merzbacher Nov. 2, 1909, nos. 3203-23 and Nov. 15, 1910, nos. 914-31 † Dieudonné, RN 1908, pp. 350-67, illus.; RN 1910, pp. 437-42, illus. Gsell, BCTH 1908, p. clxxxviii RN 1908, p. 272 † Imhoof-Blumer, ZfN 1910, pp. 1-8, illus. † Regling, ZfN 1910, pp. 9-27, illus. † Svoronos, JIAN 1911 pp. 43-6 Mazard, CNNM, p. 8 Hoard previously said to be from Alkazar (= El Ksar El Kebir), 70 km. S of Tangier
